noun.description: A high-protein pulse that is dried and then soaked and cooked before eating. There are several varieties of lentils, including green ones and smaller orange ones, which are typically sold split.
The plant which yields lentils, native to the Mediterranean and Africa and grown also for fodder.

origin: Middle English: from Old French lentille, from Latin lenticula, diminutive of lens, lent- lentil.
